conflicts.description: py-alphafold: alphafold is only supported on Linux
conflicts.name: arch=darwin-None-None

dependencies.description: An ultra fast download utility
dependencies.name: aria2

dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.
dependencies.name: cuda

dependencies.description:
HH-suite is a widely used open source software suite for sensitive
sequence similarity searches and protein fold recognition. It is based
on pairwise alignment of profile Hidden Markov models (HMMs), which
represent multiple sequence alignments of homologous proteins.
dependencies.name: hh-suite

dependencies.description:
HMMER is used for searching sequence databases for sequence homologs,
and for making sequence alignments. It implements methods using
probabilistic models called profile hidden Markov models (profile HMMs).
dependencies.name: hmmer

dependencies.description: A fast multiple sequence alignment program for biological sequences.
dependencies.name: kalign

dependencies.description:
A high performance toolkit for molecular simulation. Use it as a
library, or as an application. We include extensive language bindings
for Python, C, C++, and even Fortran. The code is open source and
actively maintained on Github, licensed under MIT and LGPL. Part of the
Omnia suite of tools for predictive biomolecular simulation.
dependencies.name: openmm

dependencies.description:
This repository is a collection of Python library code for building
Python applications. The code is collected from Google's own Python code
base, and has been extensively tested and used in production.
dependencies.name: py-absl-py

dependencies.description:
A distributed collaborative effort to develop Python libraries and
applications which address the needs of current and future work in
bioinformatics.
dependencies.name: py-biopython

dependencies.description: Chex is a library of utilities for helping to write reliable JAX code.
dependencies.name: py-chex

dependencies.description: JAX-based neural network library
dependencies.name: py-dm-haiku

dependencies.description:
tree is a library for working with nested data structures. In a way,
tree generalizes the builtin map() function which only supports flat
sequences, and allows to apply a function to each leaf preserving the
overall structure.
dependencies.name: py-dm-tree

dependencies.description: A Python library for the Docker Engine API.
dependencies.name: py-docker

dependencies.description:
A fork of frozendict, an immutable wrapper around dictionaries. It
implements the complete mapping interface and can be used as a drop-in
replacement for dictionaries where immutability is desired. The
immutabledict constructor mimics dict, and all of the expected
interfaces (iter, len, repr, hash, getitem) are provided. Note that an
immutabledict does not guarantee the immutability of its values, so the
utility of hash method is restricted by usage. The only difference is
that the copy() method of immutable takes variable keyword arguments,
which will be present as key/value pairs in the new, immutable copy.
dependencies.name: py-immutabledict

dependencies.description:
Differentiate, compile, and transform Numpy code. JAX is a Python
library for accelerator-oriented array computation and program
transformation, designed for high-performance numerical computing and
large-scale machine learning.
dependencies.name: py-jax

dependencies.description:
ML Collections is a library of Python collections designed for ML
usecases.
dependencies.name: py-ml-collections

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description:
PDBFixer is an easy to use application for fixing problems in Protein
Data Bank files in preparation for simulating them.
dependencies.name: py-pdbfixer

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral,
extensible mechanism for serializing structured data - think XML, but
smaller, faster, and simpler. You define how you want your data to be
structured once, then you can use special generated source code to
easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data
streams and using a variety of languages.
dependencies.name: py-protobuf

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.
dependencies.name: py-tensorflow

dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.
dependencies.name: py-wheel

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

description:
AlphaFold is an AI system developed by DeepMind that predicts a
protein's 3D structure from its amino acid sequence. It regularly
achieves accuracy competitive with experiment.
name: py-alphafold

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
